posts.title: Chromophobia
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘The grey legions invade the world of colour to establish their colourless dominance. Resistance appears in the shape of a scarlet jester, who restores the reign of colour using his chromatic trickery.’– Raoul Servais Foundation

posts.title: Chocolat
posts.excerpt: The international breakthrough of acclaimed filmmaker Claire Denis, Chocolat is set in a remote town in Cameroon during the last days of France’s colonies in Africa. Claire Denis’s award-winning autobiographical film traces a young white woman’s return to her youth in pre-independence French Cameroon, haunted by strong memories of black African Protee, the family’s “houseboy” …

posts.title: Steamboat Willie
posts.excerpt: Quote:Mickey Mouse, piloting a steamboat, delights his passenger, Minnie, by making musical instruments out of the menagerie on deck. Steamboat Willie is especially notable for being the first Disney cartoon with synchronized sound, as well as the first cartoon to feature a …

posts.title: Scala Milan AC

posts.title: Un dessert pour Constance
posts.excerpt: In the 70’s, Bokolo and Mamadou sweepers in the city of Paris, looking for a way to pay for the return home of one of their sick comrades. posts._title: Éric Rohmer – Nadja à Paris AKA Nadja in Paris (1964)
posts.title: Nadja à Paris
posts.excerpt: Nadja is a guest student, who stays at Cité Universitaire and visits the Sorbonne, while preparing a thesis on Proust. Besides her student life she likes to stroll about Paris, to explore the variety of this wide and open city. She knows Saint-Germain-des-Prés well, but feels more comfortable among the bohemians, painters and writers in …

posts.title: Vlcí jáma

posts._title: Jóhann Jóhannsson – Last and First Men (2020)
posts.title: Last and First Men
posts.excerpt: Two billion years ahead of us, a future race of humans finds itself on the verge of extinction. Almost all that is left in the world are lone and surreal monuments, beaming their message into the wilderness. Based on the cult science fiction novel of the same name by Olaf Stapledon, Jóhann Jóhannsson artfully combines …

posts.title: Inventing The Future
posts.excerpt: A cinematic experience that looks to the future with unwavering optimism about what humans and technology can do, about how politics can create, and about what Life can become.
